column3: Unique alphanumeric identifier for each crossing, encoding district, port of entry, and bridge abbreviation.
Official English name of the border crossing or bridge.
Type of crossing mode available at the bridge (e.g., Pedestrians/Bicyclists, Passenger Vehicles, Commercial Vehicles, Cargo/Rail).
Number of northbound inspection lanes available at U.S. CBP facilities for the given crossing mode.
Additional details about inspection lanes, such as Ready Lane or SENTRI Lane availability for pre-approved travelers with RFID-enabled identification.
Indicates whether the crossing participates in Unified Cargo Processing, a joint U.S.–Mexico inspection program for commercial shipments.
Operating hours for U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) facilities at the crossing for the given mode.
Operating hours for Mexican customs (ADUANAS/ANAM) facilities at the crossing for the given mode.
Date indicating when the hours-of-operation information was last verified or updated.
Name(s) of the authoritative source(s) providing the hours-of-operation data (e.g., U.S. Customs & Border Protection, Agencia Nacional de Aduanas de México).
URL linking to the U.S. (Texas-side) reference page for the crossing's hours-of-operation information.
URL or reference name linking to the Mexican-side source page for the crossing's hours-of-operation information.
